page.title: 12Local Characters
page.content: The most influential family in Creigiau was the Mathew family who lived at Castell-y-Mynach farm. They were men of importance in state and municipal affairs. During the Civil War, Charles I, was known to have found shelter at Castell-y-Mynach farm. A favourite motto at Castell-y-Mynach was "Heb Dduw heb ddim." One of the Mathews was commonly known as "Matho Dew." He was rather a terror in the neighbourhood because he took anything he fancied from any of the local farmers. Other local characters in the area have been Miss. Elizabeth Jenkins and her brother Joshua. They ran the village shop, Post Office and the Telegraph Exchange. John Willie Evans, the village headmaster ran a school in the village hall (later Bwlchgwyn), from 1927 to 1952.
